meanings: (하고 싶다) (동사로 쓰여) want (to), would like to, wish (to), (formal) desire (to), feel like (doing)
(~한 생각이 들다) (동사로 쓰여) look, seem, appear

meanings.meaning: I am shy if you like.
If you want a thing well done, do it yourself.
If you would be loved, love and be lovable.
Study the past if you would define the future.

examples.korean: If you want to go by bus, that suits me fine. 발음듣기 네가 버스로 가고 싶다면 난 괜찮아. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: If you want to go by bus, that suits me fine. 발음

examples.korean: It’s from my boyfriend, if you must know. 발음듣기 굳이 알고 싶다면, 이건 내 남자 친구에게서 온 거야. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: It’s from my boyfriend, if you must know. 발음

examples.korean: I’d understand if you wanted to bail out of this relationship. 발음듣기 당신이 이 관계에서 벗어나고 싶다면 이해하겠어. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: I’d understand if you wanted to bail out of this relationship. 발음

examples.korean: Use your enemy's hand to catch a snake. 발음듣기 뱀을 잡고 싶다면 적의 손을 써라. (이란속담, 원수속담) 명언/속담
examples.english: Use your enemy's hand to catch a snake. 발음

examples.korean: If you want to win, you have to play like a team. 발음듣기 이기고 싶다면 한 팀처럼 움직여야 합니다. DARAKWON
examples.english: If you want to win, you have to play like a team. 발음
